meanings.definition: To play or dance to jazz music.
meanings.sent1: She loves jazzing with her friends on weekends.
meanings.sent2: The band was jazzing up a storm at the club last night.
meanings.sent3: The kids were jazzing around the living room, pretending to be in a jazz band.
meanings.sent4: His fingers were jazzing across the piano keys, creating magic in the air.
meanings.sent5: The streets came alive with the sound of jazzing musicians during the festival.

meanings.definition: To add excitement or liveliness to something.
meanings.sent1: The colorful decorations really jazzed up the party.
meanings.sent2: She always knows how to jazz up a dull conversation.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to jazz up the party by juggling bananas.
meanings.sent4: His jokes jazzed up the atmosphere and made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent5: The new paint job jazzed up the old house, making it look brand new.

meanings.definition: To improvise or embellish in a lively and spirited manner.
meanings.sent1: She was jazzing her speech with funny anecdotes to keep the audience engaged.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to jazz up the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs.
meanings.sent3: The comedian jazzed up his routine by telling jokes in different accents.
meanings.sent4: The artist jazzed up the painting by adding vibrant colors to the background.
meanings.sent5: The dancer jazzed up her routine with unexpected twists and turns.
